Greetings to Chinese FM 
   Pyongyang, July 16 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun sent a message of greetings to Chinese Foreign Minister Li Zhaoxing on the occasion of the 45th anniversary of the signing of the DPRK-China Treaty of Friendship, Cooperation and Mutual Assistance.
 The message said that the treaty is making a positive contribution to developing the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries, promoting the socialist construction in the two countries and defending peace in Asia and the rest of the world.    
 Expressing the belief that the long-standing DPRK-China friendship would grow stronger thanks to the joint efforts of the two countries, the message sincerely wished him greater success in his responsible work.

Russian Ensemble Enjoys Performance of Korean Symphony Orchestra 
   Pyongyang, July 17 (KCNA) -- The visiting Academy Ensemble of the Interior Unit of the Russian Ministry of Interior appreciated a performance of the National Symphony Orchestra at the Moranbong Theater on Sunday.
 Invited to appreciate the performance were the members of the ensemble headed by Viktor Yeliseev, Josif Kobzon, chairman of the Cultural Committee of the State Duma of the Russian Federation who has come in company with the ensemble, and his entourage, Charge d'Affaires a.i. Alexander Matsegora and officials of the Russian embassy.    
 The Korean artistes put on the stage the 4th movement "Glory to the General" of the symphonic suite "Long Journey for Songun Leadership", the orchestras "Arirang", "Rich Harvest Comes to the Chongsan Plain", Tchaikovsky's "Capriccio Italian ", the 1st movement of Shostakovich's 7th symphony "Leningrad" and other numbers.

Gift to Kim Jong Il from Senior Official of Communist Party of Vietnam
   Pyongyang, July 17 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il was presented with a gift by the head of the Commission for External Relations of the C.C., the Communist Party of Vietnam on a visit to the DPRK.
 It was conveyed to Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, today by head of the commission Nguyen Van Son.

articles.content:
Chinese Friendship Delegation Leaves
   Pyongyang, July 15 (KCNA) -- The Chinese friendship delegation led by Hui Liangyu, member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the Communist Party of China and vice-premier of the State Council of China, left here today after winding up its six-day visit to the DPRK to participate in the events marking the 45th anniversary of the conclusion of the DPRK-China Treaty of Friendship, Cooperation and Mutual Assistance at the invitation of the DPRK government.
 It was seen off at the airport by Choe Su Hon, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, and officials concerned and Wu Donghe, Chinese ambassador to the DPRK, and staff members of the Chinese embassy here and Chinese students studying in the DPRK.    
 During its stay the delegation visited Mangyongdae, the Mangyongdae Schoolchildren's Palace, the Grand People's Study House and other places.

articles.title: Korean Women's Delegation Leaves for China
articles.content:
DPRK Friendship Delegation Back Home
   Pyongyang, July 15 (KCNA) -- The DPRK friendship delegation led by Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, returned home on Saturday after paying an official goodwill visit to China to participate in the celebrations of the 45th anniversary of the signing of the DPRK-China Treaty of Friendship, Cooperation and Mutual Assistance at the invitation of the Chinese government.
 It was greeted at the airport by Vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs Choe Su Hon, officials concerned and Chinese Ambassador to the DPRK Wu Donghe.

articles.title: President Kim Il Sung Remembered Abroad
articles.content:
Korean Women's Delegation Leaves for China
   Pyongyang, July 15 (KCNA) -- The delegation of the Korean Democratic Women's Union led by Ri Yong Hui, vice-chairwoman of its Central Committee, left here today to participate in the 6th East Asian Women's Forum to be held in Beijing.
 It was sent off at Pyongyang Railway Station by U Kye Hyang, vice-chairwoman of the C.C., KDWU, and the political councilor of the Chinese embassy here.
